p: In addition to the aforementioned medicinal plants and bioactive candidates ( Figure 2), several marketed herbal formulations are currently used for dementia treatment. Yukmijihwang-tang is a common herbal product in Korea, China and Japan used to enhance memory. It has been found to inhibit apoptosis by enhancing the expression of the neuron-specific proteins transthyretin and PEP-19 in the brains of rats exposed to neurotoxicant. 123 Another cognitive enhancer herbal formulation is a Chinese Naoweikang, containing Ginkgo biloba and Panax ginseng. It has been tested and found to modulate the cholinergic pathway against Aβ 1–40 induced neurotoxicity in the brain of Sprague Dawley rats. 124 ESP-2, a standardized Korean combined extract of Angelica gigas, Saururus chinensis and Schizandra chinensis effectively inhibited AChE activity and reversed scopolamine-induced memory impairment in ICR mice. 125
